Package huffify

Class Huffify

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffify.Huffify
  • public class Huffify
extends java.lang.Object

    Huffify

    Purpose: to execute compression and decompression operations at the request of the user using the command line and the appropriate arguments to do so.

    This is the main class of the project huffify that contains the compression and decompression methods declared as static and all the auxiliary methods that these 2 principal methods use (also declared as static)

    Besides the methods declared in this class, there are other 3 classes that are used in this project, each with its own methods and instances used to achieve the goal of this project:

    huffify.FrequencyTable - used to generate the frequencies of all characters in the text.

    huffify.HuffmanTree - used to build and hold all the data about the Huffman Tree.

    huffify.HuffNode - used to hold all the data about a certain node in the Huffman Tree.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    mehai
    See Also:
    FrequencyTable, HuffmanTree, HuffNode

    • Method Detail

      • createPQ

        public static java.util.PriorityQueue<HuffNode> createPQ​(FrequencyTable fq)
        Creates a PriorityQueue based on a FrequencyTable previously created. This PriorityQueue is used to further build the Huffman Tree.
        Parameters:
        fq - the FrequencyTable that contains the set used to create the PriorityQueue.
        Returns:
        the PriorityQueue of nodes used to build the Huffman Tree.

      • printPQ

        public static java.util.PriorityQueue<HuffNode> printPQ​(java.util.PriorityQueue<HuffNode> pq)
        Test method to check if the created PriorityQueue is valid by printing it. (not using iterator because PriorityQueue uses a heap so the iterator won't help).
        Parameters:
        pq - the PriorityQueue to be printed.
        Returns:
        same PriorityQueue .

      • numOfBits

        public static int numOfBits​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> map,
                            FrequencyTable fq)
        Gets the total number of bits needed for the entire encoded text. It does this by using the formula:

        totalNrBits = char1.numberOfBitsInCode * char1.frequency + ... + charn.numberOfBitsInCode * charn.frequency.

        Parameters:
        map - the HashMap that contains the characters and their codes.
        fq - the FrequencyTable that contains the set of nodes (char - frequency).
        Returns:
        an integer representing the number of bits needed for the entire text.

      • encode

        public static java.util.BitSet encode​(java.lang.String filename,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> map,
                                      int numBits)
        Creates a BitSet representing the encoded compressed text in bits. This BitSet can be later used (with the Huffman Tree) to decompress the text. It needs to be stored in a file named after the initial filename + extension .huff.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the text file to be compressed.
        map - the HashMap that contains the characters and their codes.
        numBits - total number of bits needed for the text.
        Returns:
        a BitSet that contains the encoded compressed text.

      • writeCompressedFile

        public static void writeCompressedFile​(java.lang.String filename,
                                       java.util.BitSet code)
        Creates the .huff file. The [file].huff contains the BitSet that can be later used to decompress and recreate the original text.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the .huff file.
        code - the BitSet to be serialized.

      • compress

        public static void compress​(java.lang.String filename)
        Does all the steps needed to achieve compression. The steps are:

        1. Creates a FrequencyTable of the text to be compressed.

        2. Serializes a Set of nodes (character + frequency) into a [file].ser, later needed to recreate the HuffmanTree.

        3. Creates a PriorityQueue (minHeap) needed to create the the HuffMan Tree.

        4. Creates the HuffmanTree using the PriorityQueue and the well known technique to do so.

        5. With the help of the HuffmanTree method buildCodes() , creates the codes for each character in the text.

        6. It creates a BitSet that represents the compressed text in bits.

        7. Serializes the BitSet into the [file].huff also later needed for decompression.

        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file to be compressed.
        See Also:
        FrequencyTable, HuffmanTree, BitSet, PriorityQueue

      • readBitSet

        public static java.util.BitSet readBitSet​(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads the BitSet from the [filename].huff. This file was created during compression.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the [filename].huff.
        Returns:
        the deserialized BitSet.

      • writeDecompressedFile

        public static void writeDecompressedFile​(java.lang.String huff,
                                         HuffmanTree huffTree,
                                         int numBits)
        Recreates the initial file before compression. The name of the recreated file is [old_filename].dec. This method takes one bit at a time and moves in the HuffmanTree in this way:

        0 - move on the left child | 1 - move on the right child

        When you reach a leaf, that leaf contains the character to be written. At this point we continue analyzing the bits one at a time from the root of the HuffmanTree.

        Parameters:
        huff - name of the [filename].huff file.
        huffTree - the HuffmanTree needed for decompression.
        numBits - total number of bits in the compressed encoded text.

      • decompress

        public static void decompress​(java.lang.String filename)
        Does all the needed steps for decompression. The steps are:

        1. Verifies if the [filename].ser and [filename].huff exist.

        2. Deserializes the Set into a FrequencyTable.

        3. Given the Set, does all the steps to build the HuffmanTree and build the codes (more details in compress method).

        4. Writes a file identical to the initial one named [filename].dec.

        Parameters:
        filename - the initial name of the file.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method takes the arguments in the command line and verifies if the flags are valid, if the filename given is valid and executes compression, decompression or prints the HELP_MESSAGE considering the necessities of the user.
        Parameters:
        args - used to identify flags and filename.
